displaytitle: On the Hills of Moret in Spring - Morning

titles.title: On the Hills of Moret in Spring - Morning

makers.displaydate: 1839–1899; born Paris, France; died Moret-sur-Loing, France
makers.displaymaker: Alfred Sisley, 1839–1899; born Paris, France; died Moret-sur-Loing, France

texts.textentryhtml: Bought by Durand-Ruel from Sisley, May 21, 1883; sold to Monteux, January 20, 1905; Montreux, Paris; sold to Durand-Ruel June 27, 1906; Durand-Ruel, Paris. Private collection; 1991 anonymous gift to Princeton University Art Museum.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1991," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 51, no. 1 (1992): p. 22-78.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1991," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 51, no. 1 (1992): p. 22-78., p. 26 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Earth's beauty revealed: the nineteenth-century European landscape, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2002).
bibliography.citation: Earth's beauty revealed: the nineteenth-century European landscape, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2002)., cat. no. 14; fig. 5

bibliography.boilertext: François Daulte, Alfred Sisley: catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint, (Lausanne: Éditions Durand-Rue, 1959).
bibliography.citation: François Daulte, Alfred Sisley: catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint, (Lausanne: Éditions Durand-Rue, 1959)., no. 351

bibliography.boilertext: Rachael Z. DeLue et al., Cézanne and the Modern: masterworks of European art from the Pearlman Collection, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum; New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 2014).
bibliography.citation: Rachael Z. DeLue et al., Cézanne and the Modern: masterworks of European art from the Pearlman Collection, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum; New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 2014)., Fig. 64

bibliography.boilertext: Senzoku Nobuyuki and Maruko Resuterīni, Shisurē ten (Exposition Alfred Sisley), (Tokyo: Ato Raifu, 2000).
bibliography.citation: Senzoku Nobuyuki and Maruko Resuterīni, Shisurē ten (Exposition Alfred Sisley), (Tokyo: Ato Raifu, 2000)., p. 67 (illus.); p. 66

bibliography.boilertext: Mary Anne Stevens, Isaabelle Cahn, et. al., Alfred Sisley, (London: Royal Academy of Arts; Paris: Musée d'Orsay; Baltimore: Walters Art Gallery; New Haven: Yale University Press, 1992).
bibliography.citation: Mary Anne Stevens, Isaabelle Cahn, et. al., Alfred Sisley, (London: Royal Academy of Arts; Paris: Musée d'Orsay; Baltimore: Walters Art Gallery; New Haven: Yale University Press, 1992).

bibliography.citation:
Sir Walter Armstrong, Robert Alan Mowbray Stevenson and Sir J.L. Caw, Sir Henry Raeburn, (London, W. Heinemann; New York, Dodd, Mead & Company, 1901).

caption: Alfred Sisley (1839–1899; born Paris, France; died Moret-sur-Loing, France), On the Hills of Moret in Spring - Morning, 1880. Oil on canvas; 65 × 92.2 cm, 84.4 × 111.1 × 7 cm (frame). Anonymous gift (y1991-65)
